column4: yo can sum1 plz help me share a dial-up connection (i did the hosting on a windows xp comp) but how do i do the client on an ubuntu 7.04 laptop?
how is the laptop connected to the xp machine?
thru a wired router (I think i have the router set up properly but I am not 100% sure)
if your inetrnet connection is on the xp machine, I think you need a switch. Does the router have dhcp build into it?
i have no idea all i can tell u is its a d-link DI-604
i have dial-up internet

i got the hosting right and on microsofts help website it says to do things on a client comp and on the wizard it says to do stuff like floppy or xp cd to it but its not windows the client its ubuntu so im stuck
I think you need a switch and not a router with modem buidlin it
you are connected to the internet through a dialup on the xp machine right?
ya
and you have internet sharing setup on the xp machine?
then you need a switch
i have ubuntu also so if i could share using ubuntu and a router tell me plz and firestarter doesnt work
I don't know if it is also possible with that dlink router. hang on
k
connect your laptop to the modem first
do you know how to use the terminal?
I mean the router
wait, connect my laptop to the modem??? how is that possible?? I have a winmodem with dell's driver for it even tho its not a dell comp
I mean the router
the laptop and desktop r connected to the router, ask me questions to c if its connected properly
do you know how to use the terminal?
well im not a genius but i can use things like repositoriy downloading and using imagemagick
open the terminal and type ifconfig in. you should see something like eth1 or eth0 . like that
http://pastebin.com/d37fb88c9
nice, now run this: sudo dhclient eth0
http://pastebin.com/d241afa65
im on desktop btw
I think you need a switch instead of a router
:'( how much r those?
those are cheap. probably 10 usd or less
r u sure tho cuz i dont need a switch to do it with windows apparently
you got a windows machine that works with this router?
ive never set up a router successfully in my life :(

let me explain how the dlink router works. The router has a DSL/Cable modem build into it and the router uses that as it's main connection to the internet and share that to the computer connected to the 4 ethernet ports.
well on the part were its spose to get internet i connected it to my ethernet port on my mobo hoping to transmit dial-up to it
wat about doing it wireleslly? i have a airlink 101 wireless card in desktop and D-Link DWl-G122 usb adapter
no, a router does not works like that, not the d-link one
if the desktop one can acts as an access point, yes, you can share using that setup.
wat setup? the wireless one i suggested?
but it's much complicated with a switch.
yep, the wireless one
i can do it with only wat i have???
note that not all wireless cards can act as a accesspoint
but ill need ndiswrapper for it i herd and thats gona complicate my life a lot
my desktop is 7.10 and laptop 7.04 i hope thats not a problem
if you can make your win xp pc as an accesspoint, it will be easy
what card you got in your ubuntu laptop?
i dont no how but i think my airlink 101 works perfectly out of the box in gutsy
laptop has usb dwl-g122 usb adapter i think revision b
you got gutsy on your laptop right?
no feisty on laptop, gutsy on desktop (i dual-boot with xp pro on laptop)
on dekstop*
ill refrase
no feisty on laptop, gutsy on desktop (i dual-boot with xp pro on desktop)***
why not upgrade to gutsy?
bcuz my laptop is not connected to internet and i have no way of making it connect, not even to dial-up
download the cd from Ubuntu's website using your xp box?
i cant download a cd on dial-up speed
i get cds thru shipit
but anyway, the easy way to setup a network sharing a dialup connection on the cp machine is suing a switch
can i plz try to make the hosting work ill test if it works by using a xp machine with the usb d-link to check
then ill worry bout ndiswrapper etc another time
o.k try to put the wireless card in windows xp as an accesspoint then
r u talking bout my desktop comp now?
yes
so u want me to go into windows? but i dont no how to set up an access point and i rely think that my wireless card works well cuz it detects networks
works well does not mean it can be configured as an accesspoint. Often cheap cards can't do that.
my card is well supported in ubuntu from wat i remember, xept my d-link thing
you can always try ndiswrapper if it doesn't work out of the box. I am using ndiswrapper myself. works perfect :)
it's not hard to setup ndiswrapper
ya but ndiswrapper is the least of my concers and that doesnt worry me atm, its just how do i transmit my dial-up "to the air" using my card in ubuntu desktop comp
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HardwareSupportComponentsWirelessNetworkCardsAirlink101
http://pastebin.com/d303e62cc
so that means wat? i need ndiswrapper to transmit to air?
I don't know. I have not tried to set it as an accesspoint.
how would i no wether i need it or not?
I can connect to the internet with gutsy using that chipset out of the box. but not sure about accesspoint. never done it before
wats the first step i need to do to transmit to air?
with transmit to air, do you mean configure it to share the inetrnet connection?
or just connect to a wireless accesspoint?
ya
no not connect, to share
do you have dialup working on that machine with Ubuntu?
ya, i am on ubuntu
mhh :( I have never shared a internet connection on Ubuntu before... :\  try google
:'(...im the worst googler in the whole world
but with the chipset rt25/61 you should be able to.
yes I am
google? try to help on the Ubuntu forum?
I have never tried to setup an accesspoint with Ubuntu before.
